Description: Ring foot and wall sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery skyphos (Type A); glazed black on interior and exterior; reserved: resting surface and underside, which has dot and circle at centre; scraped groove on lower wall on interior; small circle and a dot painted on underside; incised graffito on underside; drill hole on broken edge for analysis.
Curator's comments: Clay analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: G. Harbottle, M.J. Hughes and S. Seleem, 'The origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47 (2005), 511-518; p. 513, table 1, no.22
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 548)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1287)
